articles.author: Shubham Batra, Bansari Kamdar
articles.description: Wall Street rose on Friday after data showed the U.S. economy added fewer-than-expected jobs in July, while Amazon's better-than-expected earnings countered Apple's tepid sales forecast.
articles.title: Wall St rises on Amazon boost, US jobs growth remains moderate

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: The U.S. economy added fewer jobs than expected in July, but solid wage gains and a decline in the unemployment rate back to 3.5% pointed to continued tightness in labor market conditions.
articles.title: US job growth slowing but labor market still tight

articles.author: David Shepardson, Diane Bartz
articles.description: A U.S. judge hearing the Justice Department's antitrust lawsuit accusing Google of unlawfully maintaining monopolies in the internet search market let stand key claims made by the federal government.
articles.title: Judge allows key US antitrust Google search claims to go to trial

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: JPMorgan's chief economist said on Friday the bank is no longer forecasting a U.S. recession this year and has raised its economic growth estimate as the economy expands at a "healthy pace."
articles.title: JPMorgan raises US economic growth estimate, no longer expects 2023 recession

articles.author: Milana Vinn
articles.description: UBS Group AG (UBSG.S) is reshuffling its technology, media and telecommunications (TMT) team, elevating some bankers who joined this year as the Swiss bank charts its strategy following its takeover of Credit Suisse, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.
articles.title: Exclusive: UBS plans TMT dealmaking team shake-up -sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Icahn Enterprises (IEP.O) on Friday said it would cut its dividend payout months after short seller Hindenburg Research accused the investment firm of operating a "Ponzi-like" structure to pay dividends.
articles.title: Carl Icahn's investment firm cuts dividend months after Hindenburg report

articles.author: Ismail Shakil
articles.description: The Canadian economy unexpectedly shed a net 6,400 jobs in July while the jobless rate ticked up to 5.5%, data showed on Friday, cementing analyst expectations that the Bank of Canada will pause its interest rate hike campaign.
articles.title: Canada unexpectedly sheds jobs in July, central bank seen pausing hikes

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch, Jacqueline Thomsen
articles.description: The judge in former U.S. President Donald Trump's upcoming trial over his handling of classified documents made two key errors in a June trial, one of which violated a fundamental constitutional right of the defendant and could have invalidated the proceedings, according to legal experts and a court transcript.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump documents case judge made multiple errors in earlier trial

articles.author: David Lawder, Davide Barbuscia
articles.description: When Fitch Ratings dropped its bombshell downgrade of the U.S. credit rating on Tuesday, Biden administration officials cried foul over the "bizarre" timing and argued that it unfairly punishes them for political chaos under President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Analysis: Fitch US downgrade followed protocols, despite timing questions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Army on Friday became the second branch of the U.S. military to no longer have a Senate-confirmed leader, as a Republican senator continues to block military nominations, a move military leaders said threatens readiness and undermines retention of officers.
articles.title: US Army no longer has Senate-confirmed leader, joining Marines
